It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, glandular leaves that are adapted to arid environments. Its seeds contain a unique type of oil used in industrial applications. Lesquerella utahensis is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
